messages.title: Ostriches
messages.text: Ostriches are the largest and strongest of living birds, attaining a height from crown to foot of about 2.4 m (about 8 ft) and a weight of up to 136 kg (300 lb). Male ostriches are black, with white wings and tail. Ostriches are rapid runners and can attain about 65 km/h (about 40 mph).The eggs weigh about 1.4 kg (about 3 lb) each and have a volume of about 1.4 liters (about 3 pt). The male sits on them at night, and the female incubates them by day
